required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to describe the magnitude of respiratory complications after laparoscopic hysterectomy and cholecystectomy.

detailed_description.textblock:
The purpose of this study is to describe change in pulmonary function and incidence of respiratory complications after laparoscopic surgery.
The investigators will include 60 women scheduled for laparoscopic hysterectomy or cholecystectomy. The investigators will measure the pulmonary function by different methods during and for 2 hours after surgery. Moreover, the incidence of respiratory complications including pneumonia, respiratory failure and radiologically verified atelectasis will be registered.

primary_outcome.measure: Arterial oxygen tension 2 hours after surgery
primary_outcome.description: Change in arterial oxygen tension 2 hours after surgery

secondary_outcome.description: Change in oxygenation index (PaO2/FiO2) 2 hours after surgery

secondary_outcome.measure: FEV1 and FVC 2 hours after surgery
secondary_outcome.description: Change in FEV1 and FVC 2 hours after surgery
Change in pulmonary shunt 2 hours after surgery
Change in ventilation-perfusion ratio from baseline to 2 hours after surgery

secondary_outcome.measure: Arterial oxygen saturation 2 hours after surgery
secondary_outcome.description: Change in arterial oxygen saturation 2 hours after surgery
Change in respiratory frequency 2 hours after surgery

secondary_outcome.measure: Oxygen supplement at discharge from the postanesthesia care unit
secondary_outcome.time_frame: At discharge from the postanesthesia care unit, which will be approximately 2 hours after surgery
secondary_outcome.description: The proportion of patients who received oxygen supplement at discharge from the postanesthesia care unit in order keep arterial oxygen saturation above 93%

secondary_outcome.measure: Connection between pulmonary shunt and need for oxygen supplement
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 2 hours postoperatively and at discharge from the postanesthesia care unit
secondary_outcome.description: The connection between pulmonary shunt 2 hours after surgery and need for oxygen supplement at discharge from the postanesthesia department in order to keep peripheral oxygen saturation above 93%.

secondary_outcome.measure: FEV1 and FVC 24 hours after surgery
secondary_outcome.description: Change in FEV1 and FVC 24 hours after surgery
Change in pulmonary shunt 24 hours after surgery
Change in ventilation-perfusion ratio 24 hours after surgery

secondary_outcome.measure: Arterial oxygen saturation 24 hours after surgery
secondary_outcome.description: Change in arterial oxygen saturation 24 hours after surgery
Change in respiratory frequency 24 hours after surgery

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Participants will be followed for the duration of hospital stay, an expected average of 3 days
secondary_outcome.description: Length of stay at the hospital

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Participants will be followed for the duration of hospital stay, an expected average of 3 days
secondary_outcome.description: Incidence of pneumonia from surgery to discharge from hospital

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Participants will be followed for the duration of hospital stay, an expected average of 3 days
secondary_outcome.description: Incidence of respiratory failure from surgery to discharge from hospital

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Participants will be followed for the duration of hospital stay, an expected average of 3 days
secondary_outcome.description: Incidence of radiologically verified atelectasis from surgery to discharge from hospital

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Participants will be followed for the duration of hospital stay, an expected average of 3 days
secondary_outcome.description: Incidence of a high temperature ( above 38 degrees celsius) from surgery to discharge from hospital

study_pop.textblock: Patients scheduled for elective laparoscopic surgery

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Women
- > 45 years old
- Scheduled for laparoscopic cholecystectomy or laparoscopic hysterectomy
Exclusion Criteria:
- Weight < 50 kg
- Pregnant or nursing
- Cardiac failure
- Renal failure
- Inability to breath through a facial mask
- Inability to give informed consent
- Inability to keep arterial oxygen saturation above 90% without supplemental oxygen

overall_official.affiliation: Department of Anesthesia, Herlev Hospital, University of Copenhagen
